Judul: GEANT4-BASED MONTE CARLO SIMULATIONS FOR EVALUATING THE PERCENTAGE DEPTH DOSE IN INHOMOGENOUS PHANTOM
Abstrak: Dose distribution evaluation is a crucial matter in radiotherapy process, because it will signiﬁcantly aﬀect the clinical result. This issue is becoming a bigger problem because human body comprises a variety of tissues and cavities with diﬀerent physical properties. In order to investigate the inﬂuence of this inhomogeneity material in multilayer phantom, we carried out a simulation by using algorithms based on the Monte Carlo method; its ability to keep track of multiple physical quantities simultaneously makes Monte Carlo modelling a qualiﬁed tool. In this present work, GEANT4 (GEometry ANd Tracking) is used to evaluate the integrated doses in Percentage Depth Dose (PDD) curve for a 18 MV photon rays (produced by Varian Clinac 2100) and ﬁeld size of 1.5 x 1.5, 5 x 5, and 10 x 10 cm2. Finally, by simulating 108 particles, we found out that close attention should be paid concerning the dose calculation involving small area irradiation ﬁelds, particularly in the presence of low density material. Lung tissues, needs particular attention because the Lateral Electronic Disequilibrium (LED) eﬀect exists. In addition, a further research is also needed to investigate the cause of the appearance of spike eﬀect on rib bone's transfer medium area.
